metadata.title: US Household Income and Consumer Spending Flows, 2023
sources: Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) - NIPA Table 2.1 Personal Income and Its Disposition
Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) - NIPA Table 2.4.5U Personal Consumption Expenditures by Type
Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) - Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis
Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) - Consumer Expenditure Survey 2023
metadata.notes: All values are calendar year 2023 annual data in billions of current USD. Personal income is net of contributions for government social insurance per BEA methodology. Income flows into Personal Income, which is then split into Personal Current Taxes and Disposable Personal Income. DPI flows to consumption categories, personal saving, and other personal outlays. PCE categories combine goods and services into functional groupings. 'Other Goods & Services' is a residual capturing furnishings, communications, personal care, household supplies, and miscellaneous services.

links.description: Wage and salary disbursements (FRED BA06RC1A027NBEA)

Supplements to wages ($2,475.0B) minus contributions for government social insurance ($1,800.6B). Supplements include employer contributions for pensions and insurance; social insurance contributions are payroll taxes (Social Security, Medicare, unemployment insurance). Net flow represents employer-provided benefits beyond payroll taxes.
Proprietors' income with IVA and CCAdj, nonfarm + farm (FRED A041RC1A027NBEA)
Rental income of persons with capital consumption adjustment (FRED A048RC1A027NBEA)
Personal dividend income (FRED B703RC1A027NBEA)
Personal interest income (FRED A064RC1A027NBEA)
Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance benefits (FRED W823RC1A027NBEA)
Medicare hospital and supplementary medical insurance benefits (FRED W824RC1A027NBEA)
Medicaid benefits (FRED W729RC1A027NBEA)
Veterans' benefits (FRED W826RC1A027NBEA)
Unemployment insurance benefits (FRED W825RC1A027NBEA)

Other government social benefits plus other current transfer receipts from business and persons. Includes SNAP, SSI, education assistance, workers comp, other programs. Residual to balance personal income to BEA total of $23,585.0B.
Personal current taxes: federal and state/local income taxes, estate and gift taxes, personal property taxes (FRED W055RC1A027NBEA)
Disposable personal income = Personal income minus personal current taxes ($23,585.0B - $2,835.7B)
PCE housing and utilities: rent, owners' imputed rent, utilities, household operations (FRED USPCEHOUSUTL)
PCE healthcare services: hospitals, physicians, nursing homes, health insurance (FRED DHLCRC1A027NBEA)
Food for off-premises consumption ($1,438.3B, FRED DFXARC1A027NBEA) plus food services and accommodations ($1,362.5B, FRED DFSARC1A027NBEA)
Motor vehicles and parts ($750.4B) + gasoline and energy goods ($464.9B) + transportation services ($616.9B)
PCE financial services and insurance: banking, brokerage, insurance premiums (FRED DIFSRC1A027NBEA)
Recreation services ($739.3B, FRED DRCARC1A027NBEA) + recreational goods and vehicles ($633.0B, FRED DREQRC1A027NBEA)
PCE clothing, footwear, and related services (FRED DCAFRC1A027NBEA)
PCE education services: higher education, vocational schools, other (FRED DTEDRC1A027NBEA)
Residual PCE categories: furnishings and household equipment, communications and information processing, personal care, tobacco, other nondurable goods, other services, and miscellaneous
Personal saving: income not consumed or paid as taxes (FRED A071RC1A027NBEA)
Personal interest payments and personal current transfer payments to rest of world (personal outlays $19,590.0B minus PCE $18,833.2B)
